text.p: If a matrix has real number entries, will the entries stay real numbers when you row-reduce it?

font.p: Yes. The only acceptable row operations are multiplication by a scalar, addition, and subraction. In the case of a matrix with real entries, row-reducing will not require a non-real scalar. The sum, product and difference of two real numbers is also rational. Thus, under each of these operations, the entries will remain real.
